sage.util

Class Debug

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.util.Debug

  • public class Debug
extends java.lang.Object
    Debug provides a set of static methods that log information for debugging purposes. Debug also maintains a debug level that can be changed by a developer.

    The Debug.DebugLevels are INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL, and OFF.

    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Debug.DebugLevel
      DebugLevel defines the different levels of debug logging there are.
      static class  Debug.ExclusivityLevel
      ExclusivityLevel defines the different levels of logging exclusivity such as only logging messages that belong to the current debug level or logging messages that fall within a range of restriction such as messages between WARN and FATAL debug levels.

        public static void logError(java.lang.String msg)
        Outputs an [ERROR] message to the console.
        Parameters:

      • logError

        public static void logError(java.lang.String msg,
                            java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.String fileName,
                            boolean overwrite)
        Outputs an [ERROR] message to a file. If the file doesn't exist one will be created.
        Parameters:
        msg - The user message to include in the error log.
        path - The directory path the file is stored in.
        fileName - The name of the file to save the log to.
        overwrite - Overwrite previous contents of file if true; append to file if false.

      • logException

        public static void logException(java.lang.Exception e)
        Outputs an [EXCEPTION] message to the console.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to log.

      • logWarning

        public static void logWarning(java.lang.String msg)
        Outputs a [WARNING] message to the console.
        Parameters:
        msg - The user message to include in the warning log.
